result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa Anderman

records.addlTxt: 9:25 a.m.  Court calls 22CF38 and 22CM40.  Court calls cases, cites appearances.  Defendant Lisa Anderman not in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Lisa Anderman.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Richards advises he has not had contact with def.  Notice was sent to address on file.  Court provides background.  FTA warrant authorized.  $500/Monday at 9:00 a.m.  Adj.  9:27 a.m.  klr

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 1:39 p.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Parties go back on record in afternoon.  Def now appears in person.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Court provides background.  Def explains why late this a.m.  Def was declined rep from PD office.  Provies form for appt of atty to Court.  Def indicates circumstances have changed since she pplied for PD.  She is going to contact PD again to see if now qualifies.  Court adjourns hearing to allow def time to call.  8/12/22 at 9:00 a.m.  In 22CF38, Court addresses prelim time limits.  Def waives time limits.  Bond continues in this case.  No additional bond set.  Adj.  1:52 p.m.
10:29 a.m.  Court refers to 22CF38 and 22CM40.  DA requests warrant for failure to appear.  Court authorizes warrant.  $500 to quash with appearance Monday following arrest.  Adj.  10:31 a.m.  klr
Initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:15 AM Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad not in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lisa Anderman not in court. Court calls multiple cases.  Provides background regarding appearance date.  Discussion held.  Def was given new date in person last Monday.  22CF38, 22CM40, 22TR529.  DA requests warrant to be authorized. 22TR529 is default by court.  Cases to be rescheduled for 8/1/22, but warrant is also authorized.  DA's discretion.  JA indicates personally told def of hearing date.  Adj.  9:19 a.m.  klr
Initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:39 a.m.  Court calls case.  Def not present.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Discussion held re dates.  Possible confusion with 7/11.  Both cases to be reset for 7/11.  Adj.  9:39 a.m.  klr
Initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ANDERMAN, LISA:  6/13/22 AT 10:18 A.M.  PC hearing/Bond hearing:  Def appears in custody, DA appears.  PD info provided to def.  AE is CR, 2934 is CO.  Court has PC from Josiah Hewitt.  Chief Colassacco sworn in, direct by DA.  Chief identifies def.  Officer Hewitt is from COH PD.  Def was arrested on MI warrant.  SW was issued for veh.  Poss of meth, poss of illegal obtained drugs, bail jumping are possible charges.  Officer released.  Court finds PC for poss of meth.  Court does not have enough info on BJ or prescription at this time.  DA requests $1,000.00 cash bond.  No poss or cons of illegal substances.  Court questions def.  Court sets $1,000 cash.  Def shall not possess any CTs, including MJ, even though legal in MI.  7/11 at 9:00 a.m.   Complaint to be filed by then.  DA will also be preparing an extradition complaint.  Def indicates she will go.  Def has PD info and intends to contact them.  Adj.  10:26 a.m.  klr
